001package imagingbook.common.math;
002
003import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.isSquare;
004import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.sameSize;
005
006import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
007import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
008import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
009
010/**
011 * <p>
012 * Solves the generalized eigenproblem of the form A x = &lambda; B x,
013 * for square matrices A, B.
014 * </p>
015 * <p>
016 * This implementation was ported from original EISPACK code [1] using
017 * a finite state machine concept [2] to untangle Fortran's GOTO
018 * statements (which are not available in Java), with some inspirations from
019 * <a href="https://github.com/accord-net/framework/blob/development/Sources/Accord.Math/Decompositions/GeneralizedEigenvalueDecomposition.cs">
020 * this implementation</a>.
021 * See 
022 * <a href="https://mipav.cit.nih.gov/">mipav.cit.nih.gov</a> 
023 * (file {@code gov.nih.mipav.model.structures.jama.GeneralizedEigenvalue.java}) 
024 * for another Java implementation based on EISPACK.
025 * </p>
026 * 
027 * <p>
028 * Note: Results have limited accuracy. For some reason the first eigenvalue/-vector (k=0) is reasonably
029 * accurate, but the remaining ones are not. 
030 * If matrices A, B are symmetric and B is positive definite, better use 
031 * {@link GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition} instead, which is more accurate.
032 * 
033 * TODO: Check complex-valued eigenvectors.
034 * </p>
035 * 
036 * <p>
037 * [1] http://www.netlib.no/netlib/eispack/
038 * <br>
039 * [2] D. E. Knuth, "Structured Programming with Goto Statements", Computing Surveys, Vol. 6, No. 4 (1974).
040 *
041 * @author WB
042 * @version 2022/06/21
043 * @see GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition
044 */
045public class GeneralizedEigenDecomposition {
046        
047        static boolean VERBOSE = false;
048
049        private int n;
050        private double[] alphaR;
051        private double[] alphaI;
052        private double[] beta;
053        private double[][] Z;
054
055        /**
056         * Constructor.
057         * @param A first matrix
058         * @param B second matrix
059         */
060        public GeneralizedEigenDecomposition(RealMatrix A, RealMatrix B) {
061                this(A.getData(), B.getData());
062        }
063
064        /**
065         * Constructor.
066         * @param A first matrix
067         * @param B second matrix
068         */
069        public GeneralizedEigenDecomposition(double[][] A, double[][] B) {
070                if (!isSquare(A) || !isSquare(B) || !sameSize(A, B)) {
071                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrices A, B must be square and of same size");
072                }
073
074                this.n = A.length;
075                this.alphaR = new double[n];
076                this.alphaI = new double[n];
077                this.beta = new double[n];
078                this.Z = new double[n][n];
079                
080                // a, b are modified by EISPACK routines:
081                double[][] a = Matrix.duplicate(A);
082                double[][] b = Matrix.duplicate(B);             
083                boolean matz = true;
084
085                QZHES.qzhes(a, b, matz, Z);
086                int ierr = QZIT.qzit(a, b, 0, matz, Z);
087                if (ierr >= 0) {
088                        throw new RuntimeException("limit of 30*n iterations exhausted for eigenvalue " + ierr);
089                }
090                QZVAL.qzval(a, b, alphaR, alphaI, beta, matz, Z);
091                QZVEC.qzvec(a, b, alphaR, alphaI, beta, Z);
092        }
093
094        /**
095         * Returns a vector with the real parts of the eigenvalues.
096         * 
097         * @return the real parts of the eigenvalues
098         */
099        public double[] getRealEigenvalues() {
100                double[] eval = new double[n];
101                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
102                        eval[i] = alphaR[i] / beta[i];
103                }
104                return eval;
105        }
106
107        /**
108         * Returns a vector with the imaginary parts of the eigenvalues.
109         * 
110         * @return the imaginary parts of the eigenvalues
111         */
112        public double[] getImagEigenvalues() {
113                double[] eval = new double[n];
114                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
115                        eval[i] = alphaI[i] / beta[i];
116                return eval;
117        }
118
119        /**
120         * Return the matrix of eigenvectors, which are its column
121         * vectors.
122         * TODO: not implemented/checked for complex eigenvalues yet!
123         * 
124         * @return the matrix of eigenvectors
125         */
126        public RealMatrix getV() {
127                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(Z);
128        }
129
130        /**
131         * Returns the specified eigenvector.
132         * TODO: not implemented for complex eigenvalues yet!
133         * 
134         * @param k index
135         * @return the kth eigenvector
136         */
137        public RealVector getEigenvector(int k) {
138                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(Matrix.getColumn(Z, k));
139        }
140        
141        /**
142     * Returns whether the calculated eigenvalues are complex or real.
143     * The method performs a zero check on each element of the
144     * {@link #getImagEigenvalues()} array and returns {@code true} if any
145     * element is not equal to zero.
146     *
147     * @return {@code true} if any of the eigenvalues is complex, {@code false} otherwise
148     */
149        public boolean hasComplexEigenvalues() {
150                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
151                        if (alphaI[i] != 0.0) {
152                                return true;
153                        }
154                }
155                return false;
156        }
157
158        /**
159         * Returns the block diagonal eigenvalue matrix D.
160         * TODO: check complex case!
161         * @return the block diagonal eigenvalue matrix
162         */
163        public RealMatrix getD() {
164                double[][] x = new double[n][n];
165
166                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
167                {
168                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++)
169                                x[i][j] = 0.0;
170
171                        x[i][i] = alphaR[i] / beta[i];
172                        if (alphaI[i] > 0)
173                                x[i][ i + 1] = alphaI[i] / beta[i];
174                        else if (alphaI[i] < 0)
175                                x[i][ i - 1] = alphaI[i] / beta[i];
176                }
177
178                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(x);
179        }
180        
181        // ----------------------------------------------------------
182        
183        // unused methods from 
184        // https://github.com/accord-net/framework/blob/development/Sources/Accord.Math/Decompositions/GeneralizedEigenvalueDecomposition.cs
185        
186        /**
187         * This method checks if any of the generated betas is zero. It does not says
188         * that the problem is singular, but only that one of the matrices 
189         * A, B is singular.
190         * 
191         * @return true if A or B is singular
192         */
193        public boolean isSingular() {
194                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
195                        if (beta[i] == 0)
196                                return true;
197                }
198                return false;
199        }
200
201        /**
202         * Returns true if the eigenvalue problem is degenerate (i.e., ill-posed).
203         * 
204         * @return true if degenerate
205         */
206        public boolean IsDegenerate() {
207                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
208                        if (beta[i] == 0 && alphaR[i] == 0)
209                                return true;
210                }
211                return false;
212        }
213
214        // ----------------------------------------------------------
215
216

324// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
325
326abstract class QZHES {
327        
328        // EISPACK Routines, see http://www.netlib.org/eispack/
329        
330        /**
331         * <p>
332         * This subroutine is the first step of the qz algorithm for solving generalized
333         * matrix eigenvalue problems, SIAM J. Numer. Anal. 10, 241-256 (1973) by Moler
334         * and Stewart. This description has been adapted from the original version
335         * (dated August 1983).
336         * </p>
337         * <p>
338         * This subroutine accepts a pair of real general matrices and reduces one of
339         * them to upper Hessenberg form and the other to upper triangular form using
340         * orthogonal transformations. It is usually followed by qzit, qzval and,
341         * possibly, qzvec.
342         * </p>
343         * <p>
344         * On output:
345         * </p>
346         * <ul>
347         * <li><strong>a</strong> has been reduced to upper hessenberg form. The
348         * elements below the first subdiagonal have been set to zero.</li>
349         * 
350         * <li><strong>b</strong> has been reduced to upper triangular form. The
351         * elements below the main diagonal have been set to zero.</li>
352         * 
353         * <li><strong>z</strong> contains the product of the right hand transformations
354         * if matz has been set to true. Otherwise, <strong>z</strong> is not
355         * referenced.</li>
356         * </ul>
357         * 
358         * 
359         * @param a    contains a real general matrix.
360         * @param b    contains a real general matrix.
361         * @param matz should be set to true if the right hand transformations are to be
362         *             accumulated for later use in computing eigenvectors, and to false
363         *             otherwise.
364         * @param z    on output, contains the product of the right hand transformations if matz
365         *             has been set to true. Otherwise, z is not referenced.
366         */
367        static void qzhes(double[][] a, double[][] b, boolean matz, double[][] z) {
368                
369                final int n = a.length;
370                
371                int i, j, k, l, nm1, nm2;
372                double r, s, t;
373                int l1;
374                double u1, u2, v1, v2;
375                int lb, nk1;
376                double rho;
377        
378                // initialize z (with identity matrix)
379                if (matz) {
380                        for (j = 0; j < n; j++) {
381                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
382                                        z[i][j] = 0.0;
383                                }       //      L2
384                                z[j][j] = 1.0;
385                        }       // L3
386                }
387        
388                // L10: reduce b to upper triangular form
389                if (n <= 1) {
390                        return;
391                }
392                
393                nm1 = n - 1;    // TODO: check!!
394                
395                for (l = 0; l < nm1; l++) {
396                        l1 = l + 1;
397                        s = 0.0;
398        
399                        for (i = l1; i < n; i++) {
400                                s = s + Math.abs(b[i][l]);
401                        }       // L20
402        
403                        if (s != 0.0) {         
404                                s = s + Math.abs(b[l][l]);
405                                r = 0.0;
406                                for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
407                                        b[i][l] = b[i][l] / s;
408                                        r = r + b[i][l] * b[i][l];
409                                }       // L25
410                
411                                r = Math.copySign(Math.sqrt(r), b[l][l]);
412                                b[l][l] = b[l][l] + r;
413                                rho = r * b[l][l];
414                
415                                for (j = l1; j < n; j++) {
416                                        t = 0.0;        // dot product
417                                        for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
418                                                t = t + b[i][l] * b[i][j];
419                                        }       //L30
420                                        t = -t / rho;
421                                        
422                                        for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
423                                                b[i][j] = b[i][j] + t * b[i][l];
424                                        }       // L40
425                                        
426                                }       // L50
427                
428                                for (j = 0; j < n; j++) {
429                                        t = 0.0;        // dot product
430                                        for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
431                                                t = t + b[i][l] * a[i][j];
432                                        }       // L60
433                                        
434                                        t = -t / rho;
435                                        
436                                        for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
437                                                a[i][j] = a[i][j] + t * b[i][l];
438                                        }       // L70
439                                        
440                                }       // L80
441                
442                                b[l][l] = -s * r;
443                                for (i = l1; i < n; i++) {
444                                        b[i][l] = 0.0;
445                                }       // L90
446                        
447                        }       // end if               
448                }       // L100
449        
450                // reduce a to upper Hessenberg form, while keeping b triangular
451                if (n == 2) {
452                        return;
453                }
454                nm2 = n - 2;
455                
456                for (k = 0; k < nm2; k++) {
457                        nk1 = nm1 - k - 1; // = n - 2 - k;
458        
459                        // for l=n-1 step -1 until k+1 do
460                        for (lb = 0; lb < nk1; lb++) {
461                                l = n - lb - 2;                                 // TODO: check!!
462                                l1 = l + 1;
463        
464                                // zero a(l+1,k)
465                                s = Math.abs(a[l][k]) + Math.abs(a[l1][k]);
466                                if (s == 0.0) {
467                                        continue;       // goto 150
468                                }
469                                u1 = a[l][k] / s;
470                                u2 = a[l1][k] / s;
471                                r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1); 
472                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
473                                v2 = -u2 / r;
474                                u2 = v2 / v1;
475        
476                                for (j = k; j < n; j++) {
477                                        t = a[l][j] + u2 * a[l1][j];
478                                        a[l][j] = a[l][j] + t * v1;
479                                        a[l1][j] = a[l1][j] + t * v2;
480                                }       // L110
481        
482                                a[l1][k] = 0.0;
483        
484                                for (j = l; j < n; j++) {
485                                        t = b[l][j] + u2 * b[l1][j];
486                                        b[l][j] = b[l][j] + t * v1;
487                                        b[l1][j] = b[l1][j] + t * v2;
488                                }       // L120
489        
490                                // zero b(l+1,l)
491                                s = Math.abs(b[l1][l1]) + Math.abs(b[l1][l]);
492                                if (s == 0.0) {
493                                        continue;       // go to 150
494                                }
495                                u1 = b[l1][l1] / s;
496                                u2 = b[l1][l] / s;
497                                r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
498                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
499                                v2 = -u2 / r;
500                                u2 = v2 / v1;
501        
502                                for (i = 0; i <= l1; i++) {
503                                        t = b[i][l1] + u2 * b[i][l];
504                                        b[i][l1] = b[i][l1] + t * v1;
505                                        b[i][l] = b[i][l] + t * v2;
506                                }       // L130
507        
508                                b[l1][l] = 0.0;
509        
510                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
511                                        t = a[i][l1] + u2 * a[i][l];
512                                        a[i][l1] = a[i][l1] + t * v1;
513                                        a[i][l] = a[i][l] + t * v2;
514                                }       // L140
515        
516                                if (matz) {
517                                        for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
518                                                t = z[i][l1] + u2 * z[i][l];
519                                                z[i][l1] = z[i][l1] + t * v1;
520                                                z[i][l] = z[i][l] + t * v2;
521                                        }       // L145
522                                }
523                        }       // L150
524                }       // L160
525        
526        } // end of qzhes
527
528}
529
530//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
531
532abstract class QZIT {
533        
534        // EISPACK Routines, see http://www.netlib.org/eispack/
535
536        /**
537         * <p>
538         * This subroutine is the second step of the qz algorithm for solving
539         * generalized matrix eigenvalue problems, Siam J. Numer. anal. 10,
540         * 241-256(1973) by Moler and Stewart, as modified in technical note NASA TN
541         * D-7305(1973) by Ward. 
542         * This description has been adapted from the original version
543         * (dated August 1983).
544         * </p>
545         * <p>
546         * This subroutine accepts a pair of real matrices, one of them in upper
547         * Hessenberg form and the other in upper triangular form. It reduces the
548         * Hessenberg matrix to quasi-triangular form using orthogonal transformations
549         * while maintaining the triangular form of the other matrix. It is usually
550         * preceded by qzhes and followed by qzval and, possibly, qzvec.
551         * </p>
552         * <p>
553         * On output:
554         * </p>
555         * <ul>
556         * <li><strong>a</strong> has been reduced to quasi-triangular form. The elements 
557         * below the first subdiagonal are still zero and no two consecutive subdiagonal
558         * elements are nonzero.</li>
559         * 
560         * <li><strong>b</strong> is still in upper triangular form, although its elements have been altered.
561         * the location b(n,1) is used to store eps1 times the norm of b for later use
562         * by qzval and qzvec.
563         * 
564         * <li><strong>z</strong> contains the product of the right hand transformations (for both steps) if
565         * matz has been set to true.</li>
566         * </ul>
567         * 
568         * 
569         * @param a    contains a real upper hessenberg matrix.
570         * @param b    contains a real upper triangular matrix.
571         * @param eps1 is a tolerance used to determine negligible elements. eps1 = 0.0
572         *             (or negative) may be input, in which case an element will be
573         *             neglected only if it is less than roundoff error times the norm
574         *             of its matrix. If the input eps1 is positive, then an element
575         *             will be considered negligible if it is less than eps1 times the
576         *             norm of its matrix. A positive value of eps1 may result in faster
577         *             execution, but less accurate results.
578         * @param matz should be set to true if the right hand transformations are to be
579         *             accumulated for later use in computing eigenvectors, and to false
580         *             otherwise.
581         * @param z    contains, if matz has been set to true, the transformation matrix
582         *             produced in the reduction by qzhes, if performed, or else the
583         *             identity matrix. If matz has been set to false, z is not
584         *             referenced.
585         * @return -1 for normal return, j if the limit of 30*n iterations is exhausted
586         *         while the j-th eigenvalue is being sought.
587         */
588        static int qzit(double[][] a, double[][] b, double eps1, boolean matz, double[][] z) {
589
590                final int n = a.length;
591                
592                int i, j, k, l = 0;
593                double r, s, t, a1 = 0, a2 = 0, a3 = 0;
594                int k1, k2, l1 = 0, ll;
595                double u1, u2, u3;
596                double v1, v2, v3;
597                double a11 = 0, a12, a21 = 0, a22, a33 = 0, a34 = 0, a43 = 0, a44 = 0;
598                double b11 = 0, b12, b22 = 0, b33, b34 = 0, b44;
599                int na = 0, en, ld = 0;
600                double ep;
601                double sh = 0;
602                int km1, lm1 = 0;
603                double ani, bni;
604                int ish = 0, itn, its = 0, enm2 = 0, lor1;
605                double epsa, epsb, anorm, bnorm;
606                int enorn;
607                boolean notlas;
608        
609                int ierr = -1;          // no error 
610        
611                // compute epsa and epsb
612                anorm = 0.0;
613                bnorm = 0.0;
614                              
615                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
616                        ani = 0.0;
617                        if (i != 0) {
618                                ani = (Math.abs(a[i][(i - 1)]));
619                        }
620                        bni = 0.0;
621                        
622                        for (j = i; j < n; j++) {
623                                ani += Math.abs(a[i][j]);
624                                bni += Math.abs(b[i][j]);
625                        }
626        
627                        if (ani > anorm) {
628                                anorm = ani;
629                        }
630                        if (bni > bnorm) {
631                                bnorm = bni;
632                        }
633                }
634        
635                if (anorm == 0.0) {
636                        anorm = 1.0;
637                }
638                if (bnorm == 0.0) {
639                        bnorm = 1.0;
640                }
641        
642//              ep = eps1;
643//              if (ep == 0.0) {
644//                      // use round-off level if eps1 is zero
645//                      ep = epsilon(1.0);
646//              }
647                ep = (eps1 > 0) ? eps1 : epslon(1.0);
648                epsa = ep * anorm;
649                epsb = ep * bnorm;
650        
651                // rReduce a to quasi-triangular form, while keeping b triangular
652                lor1 = 0;
653                enorn = n;
654                en = n - 1;
655                itn = n * 30;
656                
657                // ------------------------------------------
658        
659                State state = State.L60;
660                StateLoop: while (state != State.Final) {
661                        switch (state) {
662        
663                        case L60: 
664                                // Begin QZ step
665                                if (en <= 1) {
666                                        state = State.L1001;
667                                        break;
668                                }
669                                if (!matz) {
670                                        enorn = en + 1;
671                                }
672                                its = 0;
673                                na = en - 1;
674                                enm2 = na;
675                                state = State.L70;
676                                break;
677        
678                        case L70:
679                                ish = 2;
680                                // check for convergence or reducibility.
681                                for (ll = 0; ll <= en; ++ll) {
682                                        lm1 = en - ll - 1;
683                                        l = lm1 + 1;
684                                        if (l == 0) {
685                                                state = State.L95;
686                                                continue StateLoop;             // check again!!
687                                        }
688                                        if (Math.abs(a[l][lm1]) <= epsa) {
689                                                state = State.L90;
690                                                break;
691                                        }
692                                }
693                                state = State.L90;
694                                break;
695        
696                        case L90:
697                                a[l][lm1] = 0.0;
698                                if (l < na) {
699                                        state = State.L95;
700                                        break;
701                                }
702                                // 1-by-1 or 2-by-2 block isolated
703                                en = lm1;
704                                state = State.L60;
705                                break;
706        
707                        case L95: 
708                                // check for small top of b
709                                ld = l;
710                                state = State.L100;
711                                break;
712        
713                        case L100:
714                                l1 = l + 1;
715                                b11 = b[l][l];
716        
717                                if (Math.abs(b11) > epsb) {
718                                        state = State.L120;
719                                        break;
720                                }
721        
722                                b[l][l] = 0.0;
723                                s = Math.abs(a[l][l]) + Math.abs(a[l1][l]);
724                                u1 = a[l][l] / s;
725                                u2 = a[l1][l] / s;
726//                              r = Special.Sign(Math.sqrt(u1 * u1 + u2 * u2), u1);
727                                r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
728                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
729                                v2 = -u2 / r;
730                                u2 = v2 / v1;
731        
732                                for (j = l; j < enorn; j++) {
733                                        t = a[l][j] + u2 * a[l1][j];
734                                        a[l][j] = a[l][j] + t * v1;
735                                        a[l1][j] = a[l1][j] + t * v2;
736        
737                                        t = b[l][j] + u2 * b[l1][j];
738                                        b[l][j] = b[l][j] + t * v1;
739                                        b[l1][j] = b[l1][j] + t * v2;
740                                }
741        
742                                if (l != 0) {
743                                        a[l][lm1] = -a[l][lm1];
744                                }
745                                lm1 = l;
746                                l = l1;
747                                state = State.L90;
748                                break;
749        
750                        case L120:
751                                a11 = a[l][l] / b11;
752                                a21 = a[l1][l] / b11;
753                                if (ish == 1) {
754                                        state = State.L140;
755                                        break;
756                                }
757                                // iteration strategy
758                                if (itn == 0) {
759                                        state = State.L1000;
760                                        break;
761                                }
762                                if (its == 10) {
763                                        state = State.L155;
764                                        break;
765                                }
766        
767                                // determine type of shift
768                                b22 = b[l1][l1];
769                                if (Math.abs(b22) < epsb) {
770                                        b22 = epsb;
771                                }
772                                b33 = b[na][na];
773                                if (Math.abs(b33) < epsb) {
774                                        b33 = epsb;
775                                }
776                                b44 = b[en][en];
777                                if (Math.abs(b44) < epsb)
778                                        b44 = epsb;
779                                a33 = a[na][na] / b33;
780                                a34 = a[na][en] / b44;
781                                a43 = a[en][na] / b33;
782                                a44 = a[en][en] / b44;
783                                b34 = b[na][en] / b44;
784                                t = 0.5 * (a43 * b34 - a33 - a44);
785                                r = t * t + a34 * a43 - a33 * a44;
786                                if (r < 0.0) {
787                                        state = State.L150;
788                                        break;
789                                }
790        
791                                // determine single shift zero-th column of a
792                                ish = 1;
793                                r = Math.sqrt(r);
794                                sh = -t + r;
795                                s = -t - r;
796                                if (Math.abs(s - a44) < Math.abs(sh - a44)) {
797                                        sh = s;
798                                }
799        
800                                // look for two consecutive small sub-diagonal elements of a.
801                                for (ll = ld; ll < enm2; ll++) {
802                                        l = enm2 + ld - ll - 1;
803                                        if (l == ld) {
804                                                state = State.L140;
805                                                //break loop130;
806                                                continue StateLoop;
807                                        }
808                                        lm1 = l - 1;
809                                        l1 = l + 1;
810//                                      t = a[l + 1][l + 1];    // CHECK THIS!!
811                                        t = a[l][l];
812        
813                                        if (Math.abs(b[l][l]) > epsb) {
814                                                t = t - sh * b[l][l];
815                                        }
816        
817                                        if (Math.abs(a[l][lm1]) <= Math.abs(t / a[l1][l]) * epsa) {
818                                                state = State.L100;
819                                                continue StateLoop;
820                                        }
821                                }
822                                state = State.L140;
823                                break;
824        
825                        case L140:
826                                a1 = a11 - sh;
827                                a2 = a21;
828                                if (l != ld) {
829                                        a[l][lm1] = -a[l][lm1];
830                                }
831                                state = State.L160;
832                                break;
833        
834                        case L150: 
835                                // determine double shift zero-th column of a
836                                a12 = a[l][l1] / b22;
837                                a22 = a[l1][l1] / b22;
838                                b12 = b[l][l1] / b22;
839                                a1 = ((a33 - a11) * (a44 - a11) - a34 * a43 + a43 * b34 * a11) / a21 + a12 - a11 * b12;
840                                a2 = a22 - a11 - a21 * b12 - (a33 - a11) - (a44 - a11) + a43 * b34;
841                                a3 = a[l1 + 1][l1] / b22;
842                                state = State.L160;
843                                break;
844        
845                        case L155: 
846                                // ad hoc shift
847                                a1 = 0.0;
848                                a2 = 1.0;
849                                a3 = 1.1605;                    // magic!
850                                state = State.L160;
851                                break;
852        
853                        case L160:
854                                its = its + 1;
855                            itn = itn - 1;
856                                if (!matz) {
857                                        lor1 = ld;
858                                }
859        
860                                mainloop: for (k = l; k <= na; k++) {
861                                        notlas = (k != na && ish == 2);
862                                        k1 = k + 1;
863                                        k2 = k + 2;
864                                        km1 = Math.max(k, l + 1) - 1;
865                                        ll = Math.min(en, k1 + ish);
866        
867                                        if (!notlas) {
868                                                // zero a(k+1,k-1)
869                                                if (k != l) {
870                                                        a1 = a[k][km1];
871                                                        a2 = a[k1][km1];
872                                                }
873        
874                                                s = Math.abs(a1) + Math.abs(a2);
875                                                if (s == 0.0) {
876                                                        state = State.L70;
877                                                        continue StateLoop;
878                                                }
879                                                u1 = a1 / s;
880                                                u2 = a2 / s;
881                                                r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
882                                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
883                                                v2 = -u2 / r;
884                                                u2 = v2 / v1;
885        
886                                                for (j = km1; j < enorn; j++) {
887                                                        t = a[k][j] + u2 * a[k1][j];
888                                                        a[k][j] = a[k][j] + t * v1;
889                                                        a[k1][j] = a[k1][j] + t * v2;
890        
891                                                        t = b[k][j] + u2 * b[k1][j];
892                                                        b[k][j] = b[k][j] + t * v1;
893                                                        b[k1][j] = b[k1][j] + t * v2;
894                                                }
895        
896                                                if (k != l) {
897                                                        a[k1][km1] = 0.0;
898                                                }
899                                                // goto L240;
900                                        }
901        
902                                        else {
903                                                // zero a(k+1,k-1) and a(k+2,k-1)
904                                                //L190:
905                                                if (k != l) {
906                                                        a1 = a[k][km1];
907                                                        a2 = a[k1][km1];
908                                                        a3 = a[k2][km1];
909                                                }
910                                                //L200:
911                                                s = Math.abs(a1) + Math.abs(a2) + Math.abs(a3);
912                                                if (s == 0.0) {
913                                                        continue mainloop;      // goto L260;
914                                                }
915                                                u1 = a1 / s;
916                                                u2 = a2 / s;
917                                                u3 = a3 / s;
918                                                r = Math.copySign(Math.sqrt(u1 * u1 + u2 * u2 + u3 * u3), u1);
919                                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
920                                                v2 = -u2 / r;
921                                                v3 = -u3 / r;
922                                                u2 = v2 / v1;
923                                                u3 = v3 / v1;
924        
925                                                for (j = km1; j < enorn; j++) {
926                                                        t = a[k][j] + u2 * a[k1][j] + u3 * a[k2][j];
927                                                        a[k][j] = a[k][j] + t * v1;
928                                                        a[k1][j] = a[k1][j] + t * v2;
929                                                        a[k2][j] = a[k2][j] + t * v3;
930        
931                                                        t = b[k][j] + u2 * b[k1][j] + u3 * b[k2][j];
932                                                        b[k][j] = b[k][j] + t * v1;
933                                                        b[k1][j] = b[k1][j] + t * v2;
934                                                        b[k2][j] = b[k2][j] + t * v3;
935                                                }
936        
937                                                if (k != l) {
938                                                        a[k1][km1] = 0.0;
939                                                        a[k2][km1] = 0.0;
940                                                }
941        
942                                                // zero b(k+2,k+1) and b(k+2,k)
943                                                s = Math.abs(b[k2][k2]) + Math.abs(b[k2][k1]) + Math.abs(b[k2][k]);
944                                                if (s != 0.0) {
945                                                        u1 = b[k2][k2] / s;
946                                                        u2 = b[k2][k1] / s;
947                                                        u3 = b[k2][k] / s;
948                                                        r = Math.copySign(Math.sqrt(u1 * u1 + u2 * u2 + u3 * u3), u1);
949                                                        v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
950                                                        v2 = -u2 / r;
951                                                        v3 = -u3 / r;
952                                                        u2 = v2 / v1;
953                                                        u3 = v3 / v1;
954        
955                                                        for (i = lor1; i < ll + 1; i++) {
956                                                                t = a[i][k2] + u2 * a[i][k1] + u3 * a[i][k];
957                                                                a[i][k2] = a[i][k2] + t * v1;
958                                                                a[i][k1] = a[i][k1] + t * v2;
959                                                                a[i][k] = a[i][k] + t * v3;
960        
961                                                                t = b[i][k2] + u2 * b[i][k1] + u3 * b[i][k];
962                                                                b[i][k2] = b[i][k2] + t * v1;
963                                                                b[i][k1] = b[i][k1] + t * v2;
964                                                                b[i][k] = b[i][k] + t * v3;
965                                                        }
966        
967                                                        b[k2][k] = 0.0;
968                                                        b[k2][k1] = 0.0;
969        
970                                                        if (matz) {
971                                                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
972                                                                        t = z[i][k2] + u2 * z[i][k1] + u3 * z[i][k];
973                                                                        z[i][k2] = z[i][k2] + t * v1;
974                                                                        z[i][k1] = z[i][k1] + t * v2;
975                                                                        z[i][k] = z[i][k] + t * v3;
976                                                                }
977                                                        }
978                                                }
979                                        }
980        
981                                        // L240:
982                                        // zero b(k+1,k)
983                                        s = (Math.abs(b[k1][k1])) + (Math.abs(b[k1][k]));
984                                        if (s == 0.0) {
985                                                continue;       // goto L260;
986                                        }
987                                        u1 = b[k1][k1] / s;
988                                        u2 = b[k1][k] / s;
989                                        r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
990                                        v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
991                                        v2 = -u2 / r;
992                                        u2 = v2 / v1;
993        
994                                        for (i = lor1; i <= ll; i++) {
995                                                t = a[i][k1] + u2 * a[i][k];
996                                                a[i][k1] = a[i][k1] + t * v1;
997                                                a[i][k] = a[i][k] + t * v2;
998        
999                                                t = b[i][k1] + u2 * b[i][k];
1000                                                b[i][k1] = b[i][k1] + t * v1;
1001                                                b[i][k] = b[i][k] + t * v2;
1002                                        }
1003        
1004                                        b[k1][k] = 0.0;
1005        
1006                                        if (matz) {
1007                                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1008                                                        t = z[i][k1] + u2 * z[i][k];
1009                                                        z[i][k1] = z[i][k1] + t * v1;
1010                                                        z[i][k] = z[i][k] + t * v2;
1011                                                }
1012                                        }
1013                                        // L260: ;
1014                                }
1015        
1016                                state = State.L70; // end qz step
1017                                break;
1018        
1019                        case L1000: 
1020                                // set error -- all eigenvalues have not converged after 30*n iterations
1021                                ierr = en + 1;
1022                                state = State.L1001;
1023                                break;
1024        
1025                        case L1001: 
1026                                // save epsb for use by qzval and qzvec
1027                                if (n > 1) {
1028                                        b[n - 1][0] = epsb;
1029                                }
1030                                state = State.Final;
1031                                break;
1032        
1033                        case Final:
1034                                throw new RuntimeException("this should never happen!");
1035                        }
1036                }
1037        
1038                return ierr;    // return eigenvalue index if iteration count exceeded
1039        } // end of qzit()
1040        
1041
1042        private enum State {
1043                L60, L70, L90, L95, L100, L120, L140, L150, L155, L160, L1000, L1001, Final;
1044        }
1045
1046        private static double EpsDouble;
1047        static {
1048                double eps;
1049                double a = 4.0 / 3.0;
1050                do {
1051                        double b = a - 1.0;
1052                        double c = b + b + b;
1053                        eps = Math.abs(c - 1.0);
1054                } while (eps == 0);
1055                EpsDouble = eps;
1056        }
1057        
1058        private static float EpsFloat;
1059        static {
1060                float eps;
1061                float a = 4.0f / 3.0f;
1062                do {
1063                        float b = a - 1.0f;
1064                        float c = b + b + b;
1065                        eps = Math.abs(c - 1.0f);
1066                } while (eps == 0);
1067                EpsFloat = eps;
1068        }
1069 
1070        /**
1071         * Estimates unit round-off in quantities of size x.
1072         * This is a port of the epsilon function from EISPACK.
1073         * See also
1074         * https://www.researchgate.net/publication/2860253_A_Comment_on_the_Eispack_Machine_Epsilon_Routine
1075         * 
1076         * @param x some quantity
1077         * @return returns the smallest number e of the same kind as x such that 1 + e > 1.
1078         */
1079        private static double epslon(double x) {
1080//              double eps;
1081//              double a = 4.0 / 3.0;
1082//              do {
1083//                      double b = a - 1.0;
1084//                      double c = b + b + b;
1085//                      eps = Math.abs(c - 1.0);
1086//              } while (eps == 0);
1087                return EpsDouble * Math.abs(x);
1088        }
1089        
1090        private static float epslon(float x) {
1091                return EpsFloat * Math.abs(x);
1092                
1093        }
1094        
1095/* original FORTRAN code:
1096           a = 4.0d0/3.0d0
1097        10 b = a - 1.0d0
1098           c = b + b + b
1099           eps = dabs(c-1.0d0)
1100           if (eps .eq. 0.0d0) go to 10
1101           epslon = eps*dabs(x)
1102           return
1103           end
1104*/
1105        
1106/*
1107program test_epsilon
1108    real :: x = 3.143
1109    real(8) :: y = 2.33
1110    print *, epsilon(x)
1111    print *, epsilon(y)
1112end program test_epsilon
1113 */
1114        
1115        public static void main(String[] args) {
1116                double x = 3.143;
1117                System.out.println(epslon(x));
1118                float y = 2.33f;
1119                System.out.println(epslon(y));
1120                
1121        }
1122
1123}
1124
1125//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1126
1127abstract class QZVAL {
1128
1129        // EISPACK Routines, see http://www.netlib.org/eispack/
1130
1131        /**
1132         * <p>
1133         * This subroutine is the third step of the qz algorithm for solving generalized
1134         * matrix eigenvalue problems, Siam J. Numer. Anal. 10, 241-256 (1973) by Moler
1135         * and Stewart. This description has been adapted from the original version
1136         * (dated August 1983).
1137         * </p>
1138         * <p>
1139         * This subroutine accepts a pair of real matrices, one of them in
1140         * quasi-triangular form and the other in upper triangular form. it reduces the
1141         * quasi-triangular matrix further, so that any remaining 2-by-2 blocks
1142         * correspond to pairs of complex Eigenvalues, and returns quantities whose
1143         * ratios give the generalized eigenvalues. it is usually preceded by qzhes and
1144         * qzit and may be followed by qzvec.
1145         * </p>
1146         * <p>
1147         * On output:
1148         * </p>
1149         * <ul>
1150         * <li><strong>a</strong> has been reduced further to a quasi-triangular matrix
1151         * in which all nonzero subdiagonal elements correspond to pairs of complex
1152         * eigenvalues.</li>
1153         * 
1154         * <li><strong>b</strong> is still in upper triangular form, although its
1155         * elements have been altered. b[n-1][0] is unaltered.</li>
1156         * 
1157         * <li><strong>alfr</strong> and <strong>alfi</strong> contain the real and
1158         * imaginary parts of the diagonal elements of the triangular matrix that would
1159         * be obtained if a were reduced completely to triangular form by unitary
1160         * transformations. Non-zero values of <strong>alfi</strong> occur in pairs, the
1161         * first member positive and the second negative.</li>
1162         * 
1163         * <li><strong>beta</strong> contains the diagonal elements of the corresponding
1164         * <strong>b</strong>, normalized to be real and non-negative. The generalized
1165         * eigenvalues are then the ratios ((alfr + i * alfi) / beta).</li>
1166         * 
1167         * <li><strong>z</strong> contains the product of the right hand transformations
1168         * (for all three steps) if <strong>matz</strong> has been set to true.</li>
1169         * </ul>
1170         * 
1171         * @param a    contains a real upper quasi-triangular matrix.
1172         * @param b    contains a real upper triangular matrix. In addition, location
1173         *             b[n-1][0] contains the tolerance quantity (epsb) computed and
1174         *             saved in qzit.
1175         * @param alfr and alfi contain the real and imaginary parts of the diagonal
1176         *             elements of the triangular matrix that would be obtained if a
1177         *             were reduced completely to triangular form by unitary
1178         *             transformations. Non-zero values of <strong>alfi</strong> occur
1179         *             in pairs, the first member positive and the second negative.
1180         * @param alfi see description for <strong>alfr</strong>.
1181         * @param beta contains the diagonal elements of the corresponding
1182         *             <strong>b</strong>, normalized to be real and non-negative. The
1183         *             generalized eigenvalues are then the ratios ((alfr + i * alfi) / beta).
1184         * @param matz should be set to true. if the right hand transformations are to
1185         *             be accumulated for later use in computing eigenvectors, and to
1186         *             false otherwise.
1187         * @param z    contains, if <strong>matz</strong> has been set to true, the
1188         *             transformation matrix produced in the reductions by qzhes and
1189         *             qzit, if performed, or else the identity matrix. If
1190         *             <strong>matz</strong> has been set to false, z is not referenced.
1191         */
1192        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
1193        static void qzval(double[][] a, double[][] b, double[] alfr, double[] alfi, double[] beta, boolean matz,
1194                        double[][] z) {
1195
1196                final int n = a.length;
1197                
1198                int i = 0, j;
1199                int na = 0, en = 0, nn;
1200                double c = 0, d = 0, e = 0;
1201                double r, s, t;
1202                double a1 = 0, a2 = 0, u1, u2, v1, v2;
1203                double a11 = 0, a12 = 0, a21 = 0, a22 = 0;
1204                double b11 = 0, b12 = 0, b22 = 0;
1205                double di = 0, ei = 0;
1206                double an = 0, bn = 0;
1207                double cq = 0, dr = 0;
1208                double cz = 0, ti = 0, tr = 0;
1209                double a1i = 0, a2i = 0, a11i, a12i, a22i, a11r, a12r, a22r;
1210                double sqi = 0, ssi = 0, sqr = 0, szi = 0, ssr = 0, szr = 0;
1211
1212                double epsb = b[n - 1][0];
1213                int isw = 1;
1214
1215                // find eigenvalues of quasi-triangular matrices.
1216                for (nn = 0; nn < n; nn++) {
1217                        
1218                        State state = State.Linit;
1219                        StateLoop: while (state != State.Lfinal) {
1220                                
1221                                switch (state) {
1222                                case Linit:
1223                                        en = n - 1 - nn;        // TODO: check!!
1224                                        na = en - 1;
1225                                        if (isw == 2) {
1226                                                state = State.L505;
1227                                                break;
1228                                        }
1229                                        if (en == 0) {
1230                                                state = State.L410;
1231                                                break;
1232                                        }
1233                                        if (a[en][na] != 0.0) {
1234                                                state = State.L420;
1235                                                break;
1236                                        }
1237                                        state = State.L410;
1238                                        break;
1239
1240                                case L410:
1241                                        // 1-by-1 block, one real root
1242                                        alfr[en] = a[en][en];
1243                                        if (b[en][en] < 0.0) {
1244                                                alfr[en] = -alfr[en];
1245                                        }
1246                                        beta[en] = (Math.abs(b[en][en]));
1247                                        alfi[en] = 0.0;
1248                                        state = State.L510;
1249                                        break;
1250
1251                                case L420:
1252                                        // 2-by-2 block
1253                                        if (Math.abs(b[na][na]) <= epsb) {
1254                                                state = State.L455;
1255                                                break;
1256                                        }
1257                                        if (Math.abs(b[en][en]) > epsb) {
1258                                                state = State.L430;
1259                                                break;
1260                                        }
1261                                        a1 = a[en][en];
1262                                        a2 = a[en][na];
1263                                        bn = 0.0;
1264                                        state = State.L435;
1265                                        break;
1266
1267                                case L430:
1268                                        an = Math.abs(a[na][na]) + Math.abs(a[na][en]) + Math.abs(a[en][na]) + Math.abs(a[en][en]);
1269                                        bn = Math.abs(b[na][na]) + Math.abs(b[na][en]) + Math.abs(b[en][en]);
1270                                        a11 = a[na][na] / an;
1271                                        a12 = a[na][en] / an;
1272                                        a21 = a[en][na] / an;
1273                                        a22 = a[en][en] / an;
1274                                        b11 = b[na][na] / bn;
1275                                        b12 = b[na][en] / bn;
1276                                        b22 = b[en][en] / bn;
1277                                        e = a11 / b11;
1278                                        ei = a22 / b22;
1279                                        s = a21 / (b11 * b22);
1280                                        t = (a22 - e * b22) / b22;
1281
1282                                        if (Math.abs(e) > Math.abs(ei)) {
1283                                                e = ei;
1284                                                t = (a11 - e * b11) / b11;
1285                                        }
1286
1287                                        c = 0.5 * (t - s * b12);
1288                                        d = c * c + s * (a12 - e * b12);
1289
1290                                        if (d < 0.0) {
1291                                                state = State.L480;
1292                                                break;
1293                                        }
1294
1295                                        // two real roots. zero both a(en,na) and b(en,na)
1296                                        e = e + c + Math.copySign(Math.sqrt(d), c);
1297                                        a11 -= e * b11;
1298                                        a12 -= e * b12;
1299                                        a22 -= e * b22;
1300
1301                                        if (Math.abs(a11) + Math.abs(a12) < Math.abs(a21) + Math.abs(a22)) {
1302                                                a1 = a22;
1303                                                a2 = a21;
1304                                        } else {
1305                                                a1 = a12;
1306                                                a2 = a11;
1307                                        }
1308                                        state = State.L435;
1309                                        break;
1310
1311                                case L435:
1312                                        // choose and apply real z
1313                                        s = Math.abs(a1) + Math.abs(a2);
1314                                        u1 = a1 / s;
1315                                        u2 = a2 / s;
1316                                        r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
1317                                        v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
1318                                        v2 = -u2 / r;
1319                                        u2 = v2 / v1;
1320
1321                                        for (i = 0; i <= en; i++) {             // TODO: check!
1322                                                t = a[i][en] + u2 * a[i][na];
1323                                                a[i][en] = a[i][en] + t * v1;
1324                                                a[i][na] = a[i][na] + t * v2;
1325
1326                                                t = b[i][en] + u2 * b[i][na];
1327                                                b[i][en] = b[i][en] + t * v1;
1328                                                b[i][na] = b[i][na] + t * v2;
1329                                        }       // L440
1330
1331                                        if (matz) {
1332                                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1333                                                        t = z[i][en] + u2 * z[i][na];
1334                                                        z[i][en] = z[i][en] + t * v1;
1335                                                        z[i][na] = z[i][na] + t * v2;
1336                                                }       // L445
1337                                        }
1338
1339                                        // L450
1340                                        if (bn == 0.0) {
1341                                                state = State.L475;
1342                                                break;
1343                                        }
1344                                        if (an < Math.abs(e) * bn) {
1345                                                state = State.L455;
1346                                                break;
1347                                        }
1348                                        a1 = b[na][na];
1349                                        a2 = b[en][na];
1350                                        state = State.L460;
1351                                        break;
1352
1353                                case L455:
1354                                        a1 = a[na][na];
1355                                        a2 = a[en][na];
1356                                        state = State.L475;
1357                                        break;
1358
1359                                case L460:
1360                                        // choose and apply real q
1361                                        s = Math.abs(a1) + Math.abs(a2);
1362                                        if (s == 0.0) {
1363                                                state = State.L475;
1364                                                break;
1365                                        }
1366                                        u1 = a1 / s;
1367                                        u2 = a2 / s;
1368                                        r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
1369                                        v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
1370                                        v2 = -u2 / r;
1371                                        u2 = v2 / v1;
1372
1373                                        for (j = na; j < n; j++) {
1374                                                t = a[na][j] + u2 * a[en][j];
1375                                                a[na][j] = a[na][j] + t * v1;
1376                                                a[en][j] = a[en][j] + t * v2;
1377
1378                                                t = b[na][j] + u2 * b[en][j];
1379                                                b[na][j] = b[na][j] + t * v1;
1380                                                b[en][j] = b[en][j] + t * v2;
1381                                        }       // L470
1382                                        
1383                                        state = State.L475;
1384                                        break;
1385
1386                                case L475:
1387                                        a[en][na] = 0.0;
1388                                        b[en][na] = 0.0;
1389                                        alfr[na] = a[na][na];
1390                                        alfr[en] = a[en][en];
1391
1392                                        if (b[na][na] < 0.0)
1393                                                alfr[na] = -alfr[na];
1394
1395                                        if (b[en][en] < 0.0)
1396                                                alfr[en] = -alfr[en];
1397
1398                                        beta[na] = (Math.abs(b[na][na]));
1399                                        beta[en] = (Math.abs(b[en][en]));
1400                                        alfi[en] = 0.0;
1401                                        alfi[na] = 0.0;
1402                                        state = State.L505;
1403                                        break;
1404
1405                                case L480:
1406                                        // two complex roots
1407                                        e = e + c;
1408                                        ei = Math.sqrt(-d);
1409                                        a11r = a11 - e * b11;
1410                                        a11i = ei * b11;
1411                                        a12r = a12 - e * b12;
1412                                        a12i = ei * b12;
1413                                        a22r = a22 - e * b22;
1414                                        a22i = ei * b22;
1415
1416                                        if (Math.abs(a11r) + Math.abs(a11i) + Math.abs(a12r) + Math.abs(a12i) < 
1417                                                Math.abs(a21) + Math.abs(a22r) + Math.abs(a22i)) {
1418                                                // L482;
1419                                                a1 = a22r;
1420                                                a1i = a22i;
1421                                                a2 = -a21;
1422                                                a2i = 0.0;
1423                                        } else {
1424                                                a1 = a12r;
1425                                                a1i = a12i;
1426                                                a2 = -a11r;
1427                                                a2i = -a11i;
1428                                        }
1429                                        // goto L485;
1430                                        state = State.L485;
1431                                        break;
1432
1433                                case L485:
1434                                        // choose complex z
1435                                        cz = Math.hypot(a1, a1i);
1436                                        if (cz == 0.0) {
1437                                                // L487
1438                                                szr = 1.0;
1439                                                szi = 0.0;
1440                                        } else {
1441                                                szr = (a1 * a2 + a1i * a2i) / cz;
1442                                                szi = (a1 * a2i - a1i * a2) / cz;
1443                                                r = Math.sqrt(cz * cz + szr * szr + szi * szi);
1444                                                cz = cz / r;
1445                                                szr = szr / r;
1446                                                szi = szi / r;
1447                                        }
1448
1449                                        // L490:
1450                                        if (an < (Math.abs(e) + ei) * bn) {
1451                                                // L492
1452                                                a1 = cz * a11 + szr * a12;
1453                                                a1i = szi * a12;
1454                                                a2 = cz * a21 + szr * a22;
1455                                                a2i = szi * a22;
1456                                        } else {
1457                                                a1 = cz * b11 + szr * b12;
1458                                                a1i = szi * b12;
1459                                                a2 = szr * b22;
1460                                                a2i = szi * b22;
1461                                        }
1462
1463                                        // L495: choose complex q
1464                                        cq = Math.hypot(a1, a1i);
1465                                        if (cq == 0.0) {
1466                                                sqr = 1.0;
1467                                                sqi = 0.0;
1468                                        } else {
1469                                                sqr = (a1 * a2 + a1i * a2i) / cq;
1470                                                sqi = (a1 * a2i - a1i * a2) / cq;
1471                                                r = Math.sqrt(cq * cq + sqr * sqr + sqi * sqi);
1472                                                cq = cq / r;
1473                                                sqr = sqr / r;
1474                                                sqi = sqi / r;
1475                                        }
1476
1477                                        // L500: compute diagonal elements that would result if transformations were applied
1478                                        ssr = sqr * szr + sqi * szi;
1479                                        ssi = sqr * szi - sqi * szr;
1480                                        i = 0;
1481                                        tr = cq * cz * a11 + cq * szr * a12 + sqr * cz * a21 + ssr * a22;
1482                                        ti = cq * szi * a12 - sqi * cz * a21 + ssi * a22;
1483                                        dr = cq * cz * b11 + cq * szr * b12 + ssr * b22;
1484                                        di = cq * szi * b12 + ssi * b22;
1485                                        state = State.L503;
1486                                        break;
1487
1488                                case L502:
1489                                        i = 1;
1490                                        tr = ssr * a11 - sqr * cz * a12 - cq * szr * a21 + cq * cz * a22;
1491                                        ti = -ssi * a11 - sqi * cz * a12 + cq * szi * a21;
1492                                        dr = ssr * b11 - sqr * cz * b12 + cq * cz * b22;
1493                                        di = -ssi * b11 - sqi * cz * b12;
1494                                        state = State.L503;
1495                                        break;
1496
1497                                case L503:
1498                                        t = ti * dr - tr * di;
1499                                        j = na;
1500                                        if (t < 0.0) {
1501                                                j = en;
1502                                        }
1503                                        r = Math.hypot(dr, di);
1504                                        beta[j] = bn * r;
1505                                        alfr[j] = an * (tr * dr + ti * di) / r;
1506                                        alfi[j] = an * t / r;
1507                                        if (i == 0) {
1508                                                // goto L502;
1509                                                state = State.L502;
1510                                                break;
1511                                        }
1512                                        state = State.L505;
1513                                        break;
1514
1515                                case L505:
1516                                        isw = 3 - isw;
1517                                        state = State.L510;
1518                                        break;
1519
1520                                case L510:
1521                                        state = State.Lfinal;
1522                                        break;
1523
1524                                case Lfinal:
1525                                        throw new RuntimeException("this should never happen!");
1526                                        //                                      break StateLoop;
1527                                }
1528                        }       // end StateLoop: while (state
1529
1530                }       // L510 end for (nn ..
1531
1532                b[n - 1][0] = epsb;
1533                
1534        } // end of qzval()
1535
1536        private enum State {
1537                Linit, Lfinal, L505, L410, L420, L455, L430, L435, L480, L475, L485, L503, L502, L460, L510
1538        }
1539
1540}
1541
1542//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1543
1544abstract class QZVEC {
1545        
1546        public static boolean VERBOSE = false;
1547
1548        // EISPACK Routines, see http://www.netlib.org/eispack/
1549
1550        /**
1551         * <p>
1552         * This subroutine is the optional fourth step of the qz algorithm for solving
1553         * generalized matrix eigenvalue problems, Siam J. Numer. Anal. 10, 241-256
1554         * (1973) by Moler and Stewart. This description has been adapted from the
1555         * original version (dated August 1983).
1556         * </p>
1557         * <p>
1558         * This subroutine accepts a pair of real matrices, one of them in
1559         * quasi-triangular form (in which each 2-by-2 block corresponds to a pair of
1560         * complex eigenvalues) and the other in upper triangular form. It computes the
1561         * eigenvectors of the triangular problem and transforms the results back to the
1562         * original coordinate system. It is usually preceded by qzhes, qzit, and qzval.
1563         * </p>
1564         * <p>
1565         * On output:
1566         * </p>
1567         * <ul>
1568         * <li><strong>a</strong> is unaltered. Its subdiagonal elements provide
1569         * information about the storage of the complex eigenvectors.</li>
1570         * 
1571         * <li><strong>b</strong> has been destroyed.</li>
1572         * 
1573         * <li><strong>alfr</strong>, <strong>alfi</strong> and <strong>beta</strong>
1574         * are unaltered.</li>
1575         * 
1576         * <li><strong>z</strong> contains the real and imaginary parts of the
1577         * eigenvectors. If alfi(i) = 0.0, the i-th eigenvalue is real and the i-th
1578         * column of z contains its eigenvector. if alfi(i) &ne; 0.0, the i-th
1579         * eigenvalue is complex. if alfi(i) &gt; 0.0, the eigenvalue is the first of a
1580         * complex pair and the i-th and (i+1)-th columns of z contain its eigenvector.
1581         * if alfi(i) &lt; 0.0, the eigenvalue is the second of a complex pair and the
1582         * (i-1)-th and i-th columns of z contain the conjugate of its eigenvector. Each
1583         * eigenvector is normalized so that the modulus of its largest component is
1584         * 1.0.</li>
1585         * </ul>
1586         * 
1587         * @param a    contains a real upper quasi-triangular matrix.
1588         * @param b    contains a real upper triangular matrix. In addition, location
1589         *             b[n-1][0] contains the tolerance quantity (epsb) computed and
1590         *             saved in qzit.
1591         * @param alfr , <strong>alfi</strong>, and <strong>beta</strong> are vectors
1592         *             with components whose ratios ((alfr + i * alfi) / beta) are the
1593         *             generalized eigenvalues. They are usually obtained from qzval.
1594         * @param alfi see <strong>alfr</strong>
1595         * @param beta see <strong>alfr</strong>
1596         * @param z    contains the transformation matrix produced in the reductions by
1597         *             qzhes, qzit, and qzval, if performed. If the eigenvectors of the
1598         *             triangular problem are desired, z must contain the identity
1599         *             matrix.
1600         */
1601        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
1602        static void qzvec(double[][] a, double[][] b, double[] alfr, double[] alfi, double[] beta, double[][] z) {
1603
1604                final int n = a.length;
1605
1606                int i = 0, j, k, m;
1607                int na = 0, ii, en = 0, jj, nn, enm2;
1608                double d = 0, q;
1609                double r = 0, s = 0, t = 0, w = 0, x = 0, y = 0, t1 = 0, t2 = 0, w1 = 0, x1 = 0, z1 = 0, di = 0;
1610                double ra = 0, dr = 0, sa = 0;
1611                double ti = 0, rr, tr = 0, zz = 0;
1612                double alfm, almi, betm, almr;
1613
1614                double epsb = b[n - 1][0];
1615                int isw = 1;
1616
1617                if (VERBOSE) System.out.println("QZVEC: starting Loop A ***********************");
1618                LoopA: for (nn = 0; nn < n; nn++) {
1619
1620                        StateA stateA = StateA.Ainit;
1621                        StateLoopA: while (stateA != StateA.Afinal) {
1622
1623                                switch(stateA) {
1624                                case Ainit :
1625                                        en = n - 1 - nn;        // TODO: check!!
1626                                        na = en - 1;
1627                                        if (isw == 2) {
1628                                                stateA = StateA.A795;
1629                                                break;
1630                                        }
1631                                        if (alfi[en] != 0.0) {
1632                                                stateA = StateA.A710;
1633                                                break;
1634                                        }
1635
1636                                        // Real vector
1637                                        m = en;
1638                                        b[en][en] = 1.0;
1639                                        if (na == -1) {
1640                                                stateA = StateA.A800;
1641                                                break;
1642                                        }
1643                                        alfm = alfr[m];
1644                                        betm = beta[m];
1645
1646                                        if (VERBOSE) System.out.println("QZVEC: starting Loop B ***********************");
1647                                        
1648                                        // for i=en-1 step -1 until 1 do --
1649                                        LoopB: for (ii = 0; ii <= na; ii++) {
1650                                                
1651                                                StateB stateB = StateB.Binit;
1652                                                StateLoopB: while (stateB != StateB.Bfinal) {
1653                                                        switch (stateB) {
1654                                                        case Binit :
1655                                                                i = en - ii - 1;
1656                                                                w = betm * a[i][i] - alfm * b[i][i];
1657                                                                r = 0.0;
1658
1659                                                                for (j = m; j <= en; j++) {
